results.title: A Practical guide to soft fruit growing
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
The definition of soft fruits are those grown on canes and bushes as opposed to trees, eg strawberries, raspberries etc. This video gives a practical guide for beginners and established enthusiasts on how to grow and produce soft fruits in a small to medium garden. It provides a most comprehensive step-by-step guide with a brief history of each plant and great close-up photography. Each fruit is covered separately and includes strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, currants and gooseberries with advice and demonstrations given on propagation, cultivation, pests and diseases treatment and prevention, and pruning. A brief summary is given at the end of each segment with a final overall summary of the key points for success at the end of the program. Written and narrated by John Walmsley and presented by Haden Williams.

results.title: The Queen and Prince Philip
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, Michael Gill and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Heritage the Story of Britains Builders and Collectors”.
Shows various aspects of the royal lives with special emphasis on their responsibilities towards the royal heritage of treasures and collections and the preservation of historic royal buildings. Also shows the Queen and Prince Phillip with their children and grandchildren.

results.title: Land training for rowing: weight lifting techniques
results.creator_credit: Michael Johns, Elizabeth Isaacs and Dan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rowing and Sculling”.
Land training with weights is an essential part of the rower’s technique and is often neglected by coach and oarsman. Lifts presented in this film have been chosen by the Amateur Rowing Association because of their value as specific training for the rowing and sculling action. Rowing movements used in the boat are related to individual lifts.

results.title: Rowing technique
results.creator_credit: Michael Johns, Elizabeth Isaacs and Dan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rowing and Sculling”.
This is a technical film for coaches and oarsmen. The full power of the oarsman’s body must be applied to the car and the correct movement and coordination achieved to give maximum power and efficiency. The importance of even rhythm and timing is stressed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Johns, Elizabeth Isaacs and Dan Productions

results.title: The Vatican
results.brief_description:

An interesting tour of Vatican City showing its buildings, art treasures, security guards and its residents.

results.title: J.M. Turner. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark and John Brabourne Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Reviews the neglected works of Turner, concentrating on alpine scenes which show how he completely understood nature. One of the series of films written and narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark on the painters and sculptors who from 1750 to 1900 engaged in the struggle between the classic and romantic ideals.
